svg.text: • Used in precision resistors and measuring instruments

g.text: Series compensation maintains constant total R

svg.text: Problem: Copper wire resistance at different temperatures
Given: R₁ = 10Ω at T₁ = 20°C, α = 0.0039/°C, Find: R₂ at T₂ = 80°C
Result: Resistance increases by 23.4% with 60°C temperature rise
Key: Higher T → More atomic vibration → More electron scattering → Higher R
• Choose materials based on application requirements
• Use temperature compensation when stability needed
• Consider power derating at high temperatures
R₁, R₂ = Resistance at T₁, T₂ (Ω)
ΔT can be in °C or K (same value)
